subject: Communication
title: Eye Contact: Respect or Confrontation?
description: Learn Eye Contact: Respect or Confrontation? in one minute.

hook.text: An American manager sees a Japanese employee looking down during feedback and thinks 'disengaged.

buildup.text: In Western cultures, eye contact signals confidence and honesty.

discovery.text: The rule is often hierarchy-based: in high power-distance cultures, looking down before superiors shows deference, not.

twist.text: Police interrogation manuals say 'liars avoid eye contact.' But this 'rule' only applies in some Western cultures.

climax.text: Misreading eye contact across cultures leads to false impressions of dishonesty, shyness, or aggression.

punchline.text: Eye contact doesn't mean the same thing everywhere. Context tells the truth.

quiz.question: In high power-distance cultures, what does avoiding eye contact with a superior typically signal?
